page.title: 03Rocester Village Housing
page.content: To house the mill workers they built rows of terrace houses which are still in High Street and Mill Street, they are 2 or 3 storeys high.Today the most important place of employment is the J.C.B. factory. To house workers the local council have built terraced type ,semi- detached houses, maisonettes ,flats, and bungalows for old people to rent. Private firms have also built semi-detached and detached houses for sale mainly in the Dovefields area. A new row of shops has been built to add to the older ones in High Street.There is a Primary School in the Village for children from 4 - 9. A Community Centre where people have meetings, dances and different games such as Bingo. There are 2 public houses open for drinks at lunch time and in the evening and one restaurant (where people can eat).
